feed.title: WILU 2020
feed.subtitle: The Workshop for Instruction in Library Use is an annual Canadian conference where delegates meet to discuss timely topics on information literacy.

entry.title: Registration opens soon!
entry.content: Thanks to all who submitted proposals to WILU 2020. Check back soon for registration rates.
entry.summary: Thanks to all who submitted proposals to WILU 2020. Check back soon for registration rates.

entry.title: Keynote Speakers
entry.content:
The WILU 2020 Programming Committee is excited to announce our Conference Keynote Speakers, Kim Brooks and Veronica Arellan Douglas. Their keynotes, Teaching as Though What Mattered Most was Our learning, and Counter-Narratives in Teaching librarianship set the stage for a thought provoking conference.

Photo credit: Bobtabbiner, Flickr.com
entry.summary: The WILU 2020 Programming Committee is excited to announce our Conference Keynote Speakers, Kim Brooks and Veronica Arellan Douglas. Their keynotes, Teaching as Though What Mattered Most was Our learning, and Counter-Narratives in Teaching librarianship set the stage for a thought provoking conference.

entry.title: Call for WILU 2021 Hosts
entry.content: Attention Libraries! Are you interested in hosting WILU 2021? Learn more about submitting a short proposal to host WILU 2021.
entry.summary: Attention Libraries! Are you interested in hosting WILU 2021? Learn more about submitting a short proposal to host WILU 2021.

entry.title: Call for Proposals is Closed
entry.content:
WILU 2020 Call for Proposals closed on November 18, 2019 Thank you to all who submitted a proposal!

Photo credit: Idawanie_89, Flickr.com
entry.summary: WILU 2020 Call for Proposals closed on November 18, 2019 Thank you to all who submitted a proposal!
